bill_title: revise certain legislative policies relating to the establishment of legislative districts.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain legislative policies relating to the establishment of legislative districts. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 2-2-32 be amended to read as follows: 2-2-32. The Legislature, in making the 2001 2011 redistricting, determines, as a matter of policy, that the following principles are of primary significance: (1) Adherence to standards of population deviance as established by judicial precedent and to standards of population deviance as prescribed by S.D. Const., Art. III, § 5; (2) Protection of communities of interest by means of compact, regular, and contiguous districts that have sides as nearly equal in length as practicable; (3) Respect for geographical and political boundaries so that, to the maximum extent practicable, district boundaries coincide with and do not cross county or municipal boundaries; and (4) Protection of minority voting rights consistent with the United States Constitution, the South Dakota Constitution, and federal statutes, as interpreted by the United States Supreme Court, and other courts with jurisdiction.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
